document_notes.text:
This update for nodejs12 fixes the following issues:

  - CVE-2022-35256: Fixed incorrect parsing of header fields (bsc#1203832).
  - CVE-2022-32213: Fixed bypass via obs-fold mechanic (bsc#1201325).
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: The llhttp parser <v14.20.1, <v16.17.1 and <v18.9.1 in the http module in Node.js does not correctly parse and validate Transfer-Encoding headers and can lead to HTTP Request Smuggling (HRS).
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

product_id: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Web and Scripting 12:nodejs12-12.22.12-1.54.1

SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Web and Scripting 12:npm12-12.22.12-1.54.1

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: The llhttp parser in the http module in Node v18.7.0 does not correctly handle header fields that are not terminated with CLRF. This may result in HTTP Request Smuggling.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

product_id: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Web and Scripting 12:nodejs12-12.22.12-1.54.1
